name: Everest Base Camp Trek
summary: The ultimate bucket-list trek to the base of the world's highest peak, through Sherpa villages and Buddhist monasteries.

best_seasons.name: Spring
best_seasons.description: Clear mountain views, rhododendrons in bloom, busier trails

best_seasons.name: Autumn
best_seasons.description: Crystal clear skies, perfect weather, peak season

detailed_itinerary.title: Fly to Lukla, Trek to Phakding
highlights: Cross suspension bridges over Dudh Koshi
detailed_itinerary.description: After an exciting mountain flight to Lukla, begin your trek with an easy walk down to Phakding. The trail descends through pine forests and small Sherpa settlements, crossing several suspension bridges adorned with prayer flags.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Namche Bazaar
detailed_itinerary.description: Today's trek involves a steady climb to Namche Bazaar. After entering Sagarmatha National Park at Monjo, the trail climbs steeply through pine forests. If the weather is clear, catch your first glimpse of Everest!

detailed_itinerary.title: Acclimatization Day in Namche
highlights: Views of Everest, Lhotse, Ama Dablam
detailed_itinerary.description: Essential acclimatization day. Hike to the Everest View Hotel for panoramic mountain views, visit the Sherpa Cultural Museum, or explore the bustling market streets of Namche.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Tengboche
detailed_itinerary.description: Contour along the hillside with magnificent views of Everest, Nuptse, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. After crossing the Dudh Koshi, climb through rhododendron forests to Tengboche Monastery.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Dingboche
detailed_itinerary.description: Descend through forests to Deboche, cross the Imja Khola, and climb gradually to the village of Dingboche. The landscape becomes more barren as you gain altitude.

detailed_itinerary.title: Acclimatization Day in Dingboche
highlights: Spot climbing routes on Ama Dablam
Rest and prepare for higher altitudes
detailed_itinerary.description: Another crucial acclimatization day. Hike to Nagarjun Hill or Chukhung Valley for spectacular views and better altitude adaptation.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Lobuche
detailed_itinerary.description: Trek through the terminal moraine of the Khumbu Glacier. After a steep climb to Thukla Pass, visit memorials dedicated to climbers who lost their lives on Everest.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Gorak Shep, Visit Everest Base Camp
detailed_itinerary.description: The big day! Trek to Gorak Shep for lunch, then continue to Everest Base Camp. Celebrate at 5,364m before returning to Gorak Shep for the night.

detailed_itinerary.title: Hike to Kala Patthar, Descend to Pheriche
detailed_itinerary.description: Early morning climb to Kala Patthar (5,545m) for sunrise over Everest - the best views of the entire trek. Descend all the way to Pheriche.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Namche Bazaar
detailed_itinerary.description: Long but easier day descending through Tengboche and Phunki Thenga back to Namche Bazaar. Enjoy the thicker air and celebrate your achievement!

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Lukla
detailed_itinerary.description: Final trekking day! Descend through Monjo and Phakding back to Lukla. Traditional celebration with your trekking crew in the evening.

detailed_itinerary.title: Fly to Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Weather permitting, take an early morning flight back to Kathmandu. Rest of the day free to relax, shop for souvenirs, or explore the city.

permits_required.name: Khumbu Pasang Lhamu Rural Municipality Permit

customs_etiquette: Always walk clockwise around mani stones and stupas
Don't touch religious artifacts or paintings
Dress modestly, especially in religious sites
Use right hand for giving and receiving
Don't point with your index finger at sacred objects

local_foods.name: Dal Bhat
local_foods.description: Traditional meal of lentil soup, rice, vegetables, and pickles

local_foods.name: Momos
local_foods.description: Steamed or fried dumplings with meat or vegetables

local_foods.name: Tibetan Bread
local_foods.description: Fried bread served with honey or jam

local_foods.name: Butter Tea
local_foods.description: Traditional salty tea with yak butter

festivals.name: Mani Rimdu
festivals.description: Buddhist festival at Tengboche Monastery with masked dances

prevention: Ascend slowly, no more than 300-500m per day above 3000m

summer_monsoon.notes: Not recommended, trails muddy and views obscured

autumn.notes: Best season, stable weather, cold nights

winter.notes: Very cold, some lodges closed, fewer trekkers

to_start.booking: Book through trekking agency or airline
to_start.notes: Weather delays common, allow buffer days

accommodation.description: Basic mountain lodges with twin-bedded rooms
amenities: Hot showers (paid, not always available higher up)

difficulty_details.physical_demands: Moderate to high cardiovascular fitness required
difficulty_details.technical_skills: None required, basic trekking experience helpful

responsible_practices: Use water purification instead of buying bottles
Stay in eco-friendly lodges when possible
Respect wildlife and don't feed animals

alternative_routes.name: Gokyo Lakes Trek
alternative_routes.variation: Include Gokyo Ri instead of Kala Patthar

alternative_routes.name: Three Passes Trek
alternative_routes.variation: Cross Kongma La, Cho La, and Renjo La

faqs.question: Do I need previous trekking experience?
faqs.answer: No, but good physical fitness is essential. The trek is non-technical but demanding due to altitude and duration.

faqs.question: Can I trek independently?
faqs.answer: Yes, it's allowed, but hiring a guide is highly recommended for safety, navigation, and cultural insights.

faqs.question: What about altitude sickness?
faqs.answer: It's a real risk above 3,000m. Follow the itinerary's acclimatization days, stay hydrated, and descend if symptoms worsen.

faqs.question: Is travel insurance mandatory?
faqs.answer: While not legally required, it's essential. Ensure it covers trekking up to 6,000m and helicopter evacuation.

faqs.question: What if I can't get a flight to/from Lukla?
faqs.answer: Weather delays are common. Budget 2-3 buffer days. Helicopter shuttles or the overland route via Salleri are alternatives.

name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
summary: A diverse journey through varied landscapes, from tropical forests to high-altitude deserts, crossing the challenging Thorong La Pass at 5,416m.

best_seasons.name: Autumn
best_seasons.description: Clear skies, stable weather, best mountain views

best_seasons.name: Spring
best_seasons.description: Rhododendrons bloom, warmer temperatures, occasional clouds

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive from Kathmandu to Besisahar
detailed_itinerary.description: Early morning departure from Kathmandu for a scenic drive to Besisahar. The journey follows the Prithvi Highway before turning north along the Marsyangdi River valley.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Bahundanda
detailed_itinerary.description: Begin trekking along the Marsyangdi River through subtropical forests and terraced fields. Pass through several Gurung and Brahmin villages.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Chamje
detailed_itinerary.description: Trek through narrow gorge sections with the trail carved into cliff faces. Cross several suspension bridges and enjoy views of cascading waterfalls.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Dharapani
detailed_itinerary.description: Steady climb through bamboo and rhododendron forests. Enter the Manang district at Koto, where Tibetan cultural influence becomes apparent.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Chame
detailed_itinerary.description: Trek through dense forests with occasional clearings offering stunning views of Annapurna II. Chame is the administrative center of Manang district.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Pisang
detailed_itinerary.description: Spectacular day walking through deep forests with the massive Paungda Danda rock face rising 1,500m above. Choose between Upper or Lower Pisang routes.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Manang
detailed_itinerary.description: Choose between the upper route through Ghyaru and Ngawal (highly recommended for views) or the lower valley route. Both converge at Manang.

detailed_itinerary.title: Acclimatization Day in Manang
detailed_itinerary.description: Essential acclimatization day. Options include hiking to Gangapurna Lake, visiting the monastery, or climbing to viewpoints above the village.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Yak Kharka
detailed_itinerary.description: Leave the last major village behind as you enter high alpine terrain. The landscape becomes more barren with scattered juniper bushes.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Thorong Phedi
detailed_itinerary.description: Short but steady climb to the base of Thorong La Pass. Rest early as tomorrow requires a very early start for the pass crossing.

detailed_itinerary.title: Cross Thorong La Pass to Muktinath
detailed_itinerary.description: The big day! Start at 3-4 AM for the challenging climb to Thorong La Pass. Celebrate at the top before the long descent to Muktinath.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Kagbeni
detailed_itinerary.description: Morning visit to the sacred Muktinath temple before descending through the dramatic landscape to the ancient village of Kagbeni.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Marpha
detailed_itinerary.description: Follow the Kali Gandaki River through the world's deepest gorge between Dhaulagiri and Annapurna. Marpha is famous for its apples.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Kalopani
detailed_itinerary.description: Continue down the valley passing through traditional Thakali villages. The landscape transitions back to pine forests as you descend.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Tatopani
detailed_itinerary.description: Long descent through changing vegetation zones. Tatopani means 'hot water' - enjoy the natural hot springs to soothe tired muscles.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Ghorepani
detailed_itinerary.description: Challenging climb up stone steps through terraced fields and rhododendron forests to reach Ghorepani, gateway to Poon Hill.

detailed_itinerary.title: Poon Hill Sunrise, Trek to Nayapul, Drive to Pokhara
detailed_itinerary.description: Pre-dawn hike to Poon Hill for spectacular sunrise over the Himalayas. Descend to Nayapul and drive to Pokhara to complete the circuit.

recommended.description: For extreme cold on pass day

permits_required.name: Annapurna Conservation Area Permit (ACAP)
permits_required.where_to_obtain: ACAP office in Kathmandu or Pokhara

customs_etiquette: Walk clockwise around mani walls and stupas
Remove shoes in monasteries and homes
Don't eat beef in Hindu areas

local_foods.name: Thakali Thali
local_foods.description: Traditional set meal from the Thakali people

pre_monsoon.pass_conditions: May have snow, crampons possibly needed

monsoon.notes: Trails muddy, leeches in lower sections

winter.notes: Many lodges closed, experienced trekkers only

to_start.notes: Can skip lower section if short on time

alternative_routes.name: Annapurna Circuit with Tilicho Lake
alternative_routes.variation: Add side trip to Tilicho Lake

alternative_routes.name: Shorter Circuit
alternative_routes.variation: Drive to Manang, skip lower section

name: Langtang Valley Trek
summary: A shorter trek with stunning mountain views, glaciers, and authentic Tamang culture, perfect for those with limited time.

best_seasons.name: Spring
best_seasons.description: Rhododendrons in full bloom, clear mornings

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive from Kathmandu to Syabrubesi
detailed_itinerary.description: Early morning drive through scenic countryside following the Trishuli River north. The road winds through terraced hillsides to Syabrubesi.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Lama Hotel
detailed_itinerary.description: Begin trekking along the Langtang Khola. The trail climbs gradually through forests where you might spot red pandas, monkeys, and various bird species.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Langtang Village
detailed_itinerary.description: Steady climb through forests opening to views of Langtang Lirung. The village was rebuilt after the devastating 2015 earthquake.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Kyanjin Gompa
detailed_itinerary.description: Shorter day through yak pastures to Kyanjin Gompa, spiritual center of the valley with its ancient monastery and cheese factory.

detailed_itinerary.title: Acclimatization and Exploration Day
detailed_itinerary.description: Day for altitude acclimatization with options to climb Kyanjin Ri or the more challenging Tserko Ri for spectacular panoramic views.

detailed_itinerary.title: Optional: Langshisa Kharka
detailed_itinerary.description: Optional day hike to Langshisa Kharka for close-up glacier views, or rest day in Kyanjin Gompa.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Lama Hotel
detailed_itinerary.description: Retrace your steps down the valley, enjoying different perspectives of the landscape and easier breathing at lower altitude.

detailed_itinerary.title: Trek to Syabrubesi
detailed_itinerary.description: Final day of trekking back to Syabrubesi. Option to visit hot springs at Tatopani before reaching the village.

detailed_itinerary.title: Drive to Kathmandu
detailed_itinerary.description: Drive back to Kathmandu through the scenic countryside, arriving in the afternoon with time to rest and celebrate.

special_considerations.earthquake_impact: The 2015 earthquake severely affected this region. The trail and villages have been rebuilt, but some scars remain visible.
special_considerations.wildlife: Part of Langtang National Park - chance to see red pandas, Himalayan black bears, and various bird species.
special_considerations.closeness_to_kathmandu: Nearest major trekking area to the capital, making it ideal for shorter trips.
special_considerations.fewer_crowds: Less crowded than Everest or Annapurna regions, offering a more peaceful experience.
